event: denies routinely irrigating or dilating her neovagina
no intercourse in a few months
antimicrobials changed to IV ceftriaxone, IV vancomycin, and IV metronidazole
diffuse intra-abdominal spillage of the mucus
antimicrobials transitioned to IV cefepime, IV vancomycin, and IV metronidazole
peritoneal cultures finalized to Bacterioides thetaioaomicron, Bacteroides caccae, and Actinomyces species
CT of the chest, abdomen and pelvis
open anterior midline wound with wound vacuum
transferred to the intensive care unit
placement of a right perihepatic drain
drained 350 mL of pus from the right perinephric abscess
drained 90 mL of pus from her perisplenic abscess
broad-spectrum PCR sent on the drained fluid
broad spectrum PCR from the fluid positive for Gleimia europaea, Alistipes onderdonkil, Varibaculum timonense, and Jonquetella anthropi
followed up at the adult infectious diseases clinic
repeat CT abdomen demonstrated decreased in the size of right and left sub-phrenic abscesses
transitioned from IV ampicillin-sulbactam to oral amoxicillin-clavulanate
